text.base: The iron gate hangs off a single hinge, twisted outward with a violent, surgical precision. To the south, the paved road is a black ribbon of known things. To the north, the trees don't just grow; they wait. The forest floor is a carpet of shadow that refuses to acknowledge the sun.

lens.believer: The gate wasn't forced; it was unmade. The iron is pitted with corrosion patterns that look like frost on a windowâ€”delicate, intentional, and cold. The woods breathe with a slow, heavy rhythm that matches the thrum in your own teeth.
lens.skeptic: The deformity on the gate indicates a localized force application exceeding 40,000 PSI. There are no tire tracks. No paint transfer. No hydraulic fluid. Just a clean, impossible snap. The forest density here is anomalous; the trees are spaced with a mathematical regularity that suggests a plantation, or a cage.
lens.haunted: You know this gate. You used to dare each other to touch it when the sun went down. It feels smaller now. Or maybe you've just seen what happens to people who cross it. Coming back was the first mistake. Staying is the second.

gate.description: Jagged iron teeth. The metal is so cold it feels like it's trying to pull the heat directly out of your blood.

interactions.touch: You press your hand to the cold iron. It hums - a low-frequency vibration that you feel in your jaw before you hear it. Like a generator buried deep beneath the dirt.

map.description: The plexiglass case is shattered. The map underneath has been selectively charred. The town of Kaltvik is circled in a greasy black substance that smells of old sulfur.

board_updates.label: Twisted Gate
board_updates.description: The iron gate at the trailhead was forced open from the inside.

choices.label: Cross the threshold into the dark

on_success.text: Under a shard of plexiglass, you find a sticker: 'PROPERTY OF [REDACTED] GEOLOGICAL SURVEY'. The date is crisp, clear, and exactly fourteen months in the future.

on_fail.text: It's just vandalism. A bored teenager with a lighter and a sense of drama.
